text:
E. 12th St., at the N. E. corner of Ave. C., showing neighborhood youths loitering under airing bed clothes.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr,

(1) East 12th Street, west from Avenue C. Note clearances in this slum area; that, on the right being where a four story tenement collapsed around February 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) No's 639 to 647 East 12th Street, north side, west of Avenue C. These buildings appear on the right of View No. 1; the photographer viewing same northward from the clearance on the opposite side.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The vacant space to the west of View 2 that includes the sites of former Nos. 629 to 637 inclusive. The condemned four story front and rear buildings shown are Nos. 627.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) East 12th Street, west from Avenue C. Note clearances in this slum area; that, on the right being where a four story tenement collapsed around February 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) No's 639 to 647 East 12th Street, north side, west of Avenue C. These buildings appear on the right of View No. 1; the photographer viewing same northward from the clearance on the opposite side.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The vacant space to the west of View 2 that includes the sites of former Nos. 629 to 637 inclusive. The condemned four story front and rear buildings shown are Nos. 627.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) East 12th Street, west from Avenue C. Note clearances in this slum area; that, on the right being where a four story tenement collapsed around February 1938.

(2) No's 639 to 647 East 12th Street, north side, west of Avenue C. These buildings appear on the right of View No. 1; the photographer viewing same northward from the clearance on the opposite side.

(3) The vacant space to the west of View 2 that includes the sites of former Nos. 629 to 637 inclusive. The condemned four story front and rear buildings shown are Nos. 627.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

E. 12th St., south side, east from (No. 644) a point slightly west of Ave. C., and across same to the East River, showing a clearance where several tenements (No.'s 646 to 654 inclusive) formerly stood.

March 24, 1938.

P. L. Sperr,

(1 & 2)

Avenue C, west side, north from East 12th to 14th Streets, and showing in the foreground a vacant space where No. 199-201 Avenue C formerly stood, and which recently collapsed. No. 2 shows same in detail.

P. L. Sperr

(3)

A view showing solely the 13th to 14th Streets block. Note also a recent demolition here in the City's slum condemnation program.

P. L. Sperr

March 24, 1938.

(1 & 2)

Avenue C, west side, north from East 12th to 14th Streets, and showing in the foreground a vacant space where No. 199-201 Avenue C formerly stood, and which recently collapsed. No. 2 shows same in detail.

(3)
